oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Review of current anaplasmosis control strategies and future directions
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Reppert, Emily J.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: anaplasmosis
transmission
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Anaplasma marginale, causative agent of bovine anaplasmosis, is the most prevalent tick-transmitted disease of cattle worldwide and a major obstacle to profitable beef production. Bovine anaplasmosis control strategies rely upon the use of vector control, vaccination, and tetracycline antimicrobials. This article reviews transmission as well as current and future directions for control.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2019 Recent Graduate Proceedings; 71-72
